content:
To get to The Daily Grind from the previous train stop, I'd recommend following these directions:

1. From the train stop, exit the station and head east on Station Street towards Main Street.
2. Continue walking on Station Street for about 4 minutes until you reach the intersection with Elm Street.
3. Turn left onto Elm Street and walk north for about 2 minutes until you reach the intersection with Oak Avenue.
4. Turn right onto Oak Avenue and walk east for about 1 minute until you see The Daily Grind on your left-hand side.

Some landmarks to keep an eye out for:

* As you exit the train station, you'll see a large clock tower on your right-hand side. This is a great reference point to help you navigate.
* On Station Street, you'll pass by a small park with a fountain and some benches. This is a nice spot to take a quick break if you need to.
* When you turn onto Elm Street, you'll see a large office building with a distinctive green glass façade. This is a prominent landmark in the area.
* On Oak Avenue, you'll pass by a small bakery with a delicious aroma wafting out. You might want to grab a pastry to go with your coffee!

The Daily Grind is located in a small strip of shops, so keep an eye out for the sign with their logo – a stylized coffee cup with a smile.

The total walking distance is about 0.7 miles and should take around 12-15 minutes to complete, depending on your pace. You can also use a mapping app like Google Maps to get the most up-to-date directions and estimated walking time.

If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask!
